teaser: Congress failed to reach an agreement over a spending bill Monday night. That means a government shutdown has been put into effect. We have the latest from Washington D.C. The new Affordable Care Act health exchanges go live Tuesday morning and the success of the law relies heavily on young, healthy people to sign up. We hear from one of those young people at a bakery in Philadelphia. And Spain is hoping a little time travel will help its economic woes, but will it work?
byline: D Gorenstein, David Gura, Dan Weissmann, Rupert Wingfield-Hayes, Chester Wisniewski, Molly Wood, Bruce Johnson, Mark Garrison, Sabri Ben-Achour and Johnny Niemann
itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Tuesday, October 1, 2013

title: Marketplace Morning Report for Tuesday, October 1, 2013
description: Congress failed to reach an agreement over a spending bill Monday night. That means a government shutdown has been put into effect. We have the latest from Washington D.C. The new Affordable Care Act health exchanges go live Tuesday morning and the success of the law relies heavily on young, healthy people to sign up. We hear from one of those young people at a bakery in Philadelphia. And Spain is hoping a little time travel will help its economic woes, but will it work?
